alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 1:11PM EST until December 18 at 4:34PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey, including the following counties, Burlington, Camden, Gloucester and Mercer and southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks, Delaware, Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM EST, Flooding is ongoing across portions of the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - For South Branch Pennsauken Creek at Cherry Hill: At 12:15pm the stage was 9.33 feet. Flood Stage is 9 feet. ... For Cooper at Haddonfield: At 12:00pm the stage was 3.26 feet. Flood Stage is 4.5 feet. ... For Pennypack Creek at Pennypack: At 1:00pm the stage was 9.73 feet. Flood Stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
